description.narrative: Reported results indicators by the European Commission ¿ International Cooperation and Development (DEVCO) may not represent the complete set of indicators monitored for the project. The results are reported using a contribution approach. This means that where a project has been financed by the EU jointly with other funders ¿ such as partner country governments or other donors ¿ the overall outputs of the collective effort are reported rather than outputs attributed to the share of funding provided by the EU. For higher levels of results, such as outcomes and impacts, the project will only have contributed to the overall effort.

title.narrative: Percentage Availability (inverse of stock-outs) of essential "tracer" drugs at Autonomous Medical Supply System (Servico Autonomo de Medicamentos e Equipamentos de Saude-SAMES) * Tracer products: These are essential or key medicines that are selected to regularly evaluate the functioning of the drug management system. They are selected as tracer products on the basis of relevance to local public health priorities and should be available at all times at the health facilities. Examples include amoxicillin and paracetamol.

description.narrative: Percentage Availability (inverse of stock-outs) of essential "tracer" drugs at Autonomous Medical Supply System (Servico Autonomo de Medicamentos e Equipamentos de Saude-SAMES) * Tracer products: These are essential or key medicines that are selected to regularly evaluate the functioning of the drug management system. They are selected as tracer products on the basis of relevance to local public health priorities and should be available at all times at the health facilities. Examples include amoxicillin and paracetamol.

title.narrative: Percentage Availability (inverse of stock-outs) of essential "tracer" drugs at Autonomous Medical Supply System (Servico Autonomo de Medicamentos e Equipamentos de Saude-SAMES) * Tracer products: These are essential or key medicines that are selected to regularly evaluate the functioning of the drug management system. They are selected as tracer products on the basis of relevance to local public health priorities and should be available at all times at the health facilities. Examples include amoxicillin and paracetamol.

baseline.value: The Ministry of Health does not have a coherent system to collect, analyze, interpret or act on Health Data.

comment.narrative: The Ministry of Health does not have a coherent system to collect, analyze, interpret or act on Health Data.

target.value: A coherent Ministry of Health-based organisational system for collecting, collating and using Health information [for planning and programming] is established and in use.

comment.narrative: A coherent Ministry of Health-based organisational system for collecting, collating and using Health information [for planning and programming] is established and in use.

actual.value: A coherent Ministry of Health-based system appropriate for monitoring, evaluation and using Health information [for planning and programming] is established.
